Uses of Class
checkers.Location

Uses of Location in checkers
 

Methods in checkers that return Location
static Location Location.fromString(java.lang.String str)
          Gives a Location based on the string given, must be in form "row, col"
 Location Location.getAdjacentLocation(int direction)
          Gets the adjacent location in any one of the eight compass directions.
 Location Move.getFrom()
          Returns the from location
 Location Piece.getLocation()
          Returns current location
 Location Move.getTo()
          Returns the to location
 

Methods in checkers that return types with arguments of type Location

 java.util.LinkedList<Location> Grid.getAllValidLocs(java.awt.Color c)
          Returns all valid locations for pieces of Color c.

Methods in checkers with parameters of type Location
 double Location.distanceTo(Location L)
          Returns distance to another location using Geometric Distance Formula
 int Location.getDirectionToward(Location target)
          Returns the direction from this location toward another location.

 boolean Grid.isPieceAt(Location L)
          isValid function, also checks if there is piece at specified location Returns true if there is a piece at specified location Returns false if there is no piece at specified location OR specified location is invalid
 boolean Grid.isValid(Location L)
          Checks if the location is valid within the grid, NOTE: does not check whether there is a piece at given location
 void Piece.moveTo(Location newL)
          changes the Location to newL, performs various actions needed to move this piece while following all rules of checkers.
 Piece Grid.pieceAt(Location L)
          Returns piece at given location Precondition: Location is valid within the grid
 void Piece.removeJumpedPieces(Location L, Location newL)
          Removes pieces to be taken when moving from L to newL
 Piece Grid.removePiece(Location L)
          Removes piece at specified location Precondition: location is valid within the grid
 void Piece.setLocation(Location newL)
          Sets the location of this piece to newL
